text: Bithynia was an old kingdom of a Roman province in the northwest of Asia Minor.Matthew Bunson, Encyclopedia of the Roman Empire (New York: Facts On File, 2002), p. 76 It was at the coast of the Black Sea. It was named after the Bithyni, a tribe that moved there from Thrace. It was an important territory for the Roman empire.
